description: Word 2016 Expert takes users to the next level in document processing.  This series explores how to enhance long documents with episodes that include: creating a table of contents, generating an index, adding footnotes and endnotes, inserting bookmarks and cross references, labeling figures with captions, and citing references for a bibliography. Also covered in long documents is how to create a master document and add sub documents for large projects. Other topics in this series include how to collaborate in Word and through Office 365 online, secure your documents, and add or edit document properties. While Word 2016 Expert is a continuation from the Word 2016 Advanced and Essentials series, episodes can be viewed individually for specific topics or enjoyed in sequence.

Also covered in long documents is how to create a master document and add sub documents for large projects. Other topics in this series include how to collaborate in Word and through Office 365 online, secure your documents, and add or edit document properties. While Word 2016 Expert is a continuation from the Word 2016 Advanced and Essentials series, episodes can be viewed individually for specific topics or enjoyed in sequence.
name: Word 2016 Expert
subtitle: Document and word processing software

episodes.description: Word 2016 Expert takes users to the next level in document processing.  This series explores how to enhance long documents with episodes that include: creating a table of contents, generating an index, adding footnotes and endnotes, inserting bookmarks and cross references, labeling figures with captions, and citing references for a bibliography. Also covered in long documents is how to create a master document and add sub documents for large projects. Other topics in this series include how to collaborate in Word and through Office 365 online, secure your documents, and add or edit document properties. While Word 2016 Expert is a continuation from the Word 2016 Advanced and Essentials series, episodes can be viewed individually for specific topics or enjoyed in sequence.
episodes.title: Overview

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne demonstrate and explain using bookmarks and cross references. Here they show you bookmark specifics like marking a location, naming conventions, and selecting a range of content. Then they look at cross reference specifics like using hyperlinks and choosing what text to display as the cross reference.
episodes.title: Bookmarks and Cross References

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne show you how to insert a table of contents (TOC) into your Word documents. Here they will go over heading levels (styles), TOC templates, map to custom styles for TOC, updating TOC, and removing TOC.
episodes.title: Table of Contents

episodes.description: Vonne and Daniel show how to manually mark words and ranges to be included in an index and then how generate the index. They also cover how to auto mark entries from a concordance file, how to update and format an index, and how to remove marked entries.
episodes.title: Create Index

episodes.description: Citing work for use in research or academic papers is very important. In this episode, Vonne and Zach show you how easy Word has made it to add and manage sources, insert citations, and generate and update a bibliography.
episodes.title: Citations and Bibliography

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Vonne discuss footnotes and endnotes. They cover how to add, format, update, delete, and convert footnotes and/or endnotes in a Word document.
episodes.title: Footnotes and Endnotes

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Zach demonstrate adding captions to graphical elements. They cover how to create custom labels, how to insert or delete captions that should automatically update (and how to force them to update when it doesn’t auto update), and ultimately generate a table of figures.
episodes.title: Captions and Table of Figures

episodes.description: Vonne and Zach demonstrate how to create a master document and use the Outlining tab on the Ribbon. They show how to add, collapse and expand, and unlink subdocuments. They also discuss the importance of using consistent headings.
episodes.title: Master Document

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne show you how to track changes made to documents in Word 2016. Here you will specifically learn how to enable/disable tracking, add comments, make changes, and how to modify display preferences. They demonstrate how to review tracked changes by accepting or rejecting changes as well as deleting comments. They also show how to lock tracking so collaborators cannot turn them off.
episodes.title: Track Changes

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne take a look at two separate, yet related functions – compare documents and combine documents. First, they explore using compare documents which allows you to merge two documents together and Word highlights the differences. Next, they show you how to combine tracked edits from multiple documents into a single document.
episodes.title: Compare and Combine Documents

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne show you how to collaborate with others to make edits in your documents using OneDrive and other Office 365 account features. They will explain how to invite collaborators, chat in real time, and remove sharing in OneDrive when necessary. They demonstrate using both locally installed Word and Word Online.
episodes.title: Collaborate Online

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne go over some important security features found in Word 2016. Specific features you'll see here includes, hidden text, restrict editing, and adding password protection to a document.
episodes.title: Document Security

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne continue looking at security features found in Word 2016. They round out the topic by showing you how to restrict access to documents as well as covering the basics of working with digital signatures.
episodes.title: Document Security Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne continue looking at security features in Word 2016. Here they finish by looking at a few more details with regards to editing restrictions.
episodes.title: Document Security Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne demonstrate working with document properties which will help make a document more searchable as well as adding more usable information to a document. This is also known as metadata. They also discuss important features such as inspect a document, check accessibility, and check compatibility.
episodes.title: Document Properties

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne explore the exciting world of Forms in Word 2016. Here they will show you how to create a re-usable, custom form that will enable you to have fillable fields, checkboxes, and dynamic tables.
episodes.title: Forms

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne show you how to customize the Word User Interface(UI) to suit your personal tastes. Specific customizations covered here includes: customizing the Ribbon, custom keyboard shortcuts, editing options, printing options, and more.
episodes.title: Customize Interface
